channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mamdani's rise in NYC reflects generational fight within the Democratic Party
item.description: Newcomer Zohran Mamdani, age 34, has used social media and big progressive ideas to shoulder past Andrew Cuomo, who's 67 and long a member of Democrat...

item.title: Spanish league cancels plans for Barcelona to play regular-season match in Miami
item.description: The Spanish soccer league said Tuesday that plans for Barcelona to play a game against Villarreal outside Miami in December have been called off, foll...

item.title: The federal government is still shut down. Here's what that means across the country
item.description: The federal government remains shut down. The NPR Network is following the ways the shutdown is affecting services across the country.

item.title: Trump uses 'common sense' to make a political point. It has populist appeal
item.description: The phrase appeals more to several demographics that strongly align with Trump, says Republican strategist Frank Luntz, including older voters, for wh...

item.title: Mental exercise can reverse a brain change linked to aging, study finds
item.description: Scientists have found the first compelling evidence that cognitive training can boost levels of a brain chemical that typically declines as people age...

item.title: Ballet Icon Misty Copeland | 60 Minutes Archive
item.description: Ballet lifted Misty Copeland from poverty, over assumptions about race and through injury. In 2015, Bill Whitaker profiled Copeland, just weeks before...

item.title: Inmate asks to meet with governor hours before nitrogen execution
item.description: A jury convicted Anthony Boyd of capital murder for the 1993 burning death of Gregory Huguley in Talladega County.

item.title: Colombian killed in U.S. strike was on a fishing trip, wife claims
item.description: Alejandro Carranza's family is questioning U.S. claims that he was carrying narcotics aboard a small vessel targeted last month.

item.title: Louvre reopens three days after French crown jewels stolen
item.description: The world's most-visited museum shut its doors after jewels worth tens of millions were stolen on Sunday.

item.title: Russian strikes kill 6 just hours after Trump-Putin summit plan scrapped
item.description: As Trump's plan to meet Putin is called off, Zelenskyy says another bloody night in Ukraine shows Russia isn't feeling "enough pressure for dragging o...

item.title: Children among victims in Russian air strikes, hours after Trump-Putin talks shelved
item.description: The drone and missile attacks on Ukraine came as the US president put on hold his plans for an imminent summit in Budapest.

item.title: More than 40 dead after multi-vehicle crash in Uganda
item.description: The crash involved two buses, a lorry and a car, police say, with many also injured.

item.title: 10/21: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: President Trump demands DOJ pay him $230 million over past federal cases, the New York Times reports; PBS documentary “The Rise of RFK Jr.” debuts.

item.title: 'We fear for our souls' - Nigerian farmers need armed guards to protect them from jihadists
item.description: Armed guards and special buses are increasingly used to coax terrified farmers back into growing food.

item.title: Mosquitoes found in Iceland for first time after record heat
item.description: Previously the country was one of the world's only mosquito-free zones.

item.title: San Francisco leaders push back against Trump’s National Guard threat
In Chicago, an immense show of force signals a sharp escalation in White House immigration crackdown
What to know about efforts to block National Guard deployments in Chicago, Portland, other US cities
